moves.1. e4 c5 2. g3 Nc6 3. Bg2 g6 4. c3: Sicilian, Alapin's Variation (2.c3)  I play Sicilian alot, but I rarely see this opening.  To me, this seems like a too passive approach for myself... so I did not look forward to this game
moves.4... Bg7 5. Ne2 e5 6. b3 Nf6 7. Qc2 O-O: Probably my lowest point in this game.  I thought that he'd have to ruin his pretty king side structure to defend against this piece (I was thinking 11. h3), but apparently that was not the case
moves.11. Bh3: The wise counter from my able opponent
moves.11... Nf6 12. d4 d6: Similarly I felt nervous at this point... I need to learn how to deal with backwards pawns in the middle.  Or atleast I should atleast remember to avoid them.
moves.13. g4 Re8 14. d5: Another low point, I was sure that he'd win at this point with a safe advanced pawn.  Castle queen side, advance the C and F pawn to destroy my interior and I would be screwed.
moves.14... Ne7 15. f3: Another reason why you don't advance the f pawn before you are secure.  His e pawn was well defended by 2 pieces and was at no risk.
moves.15... Nexd5: A questionable sacrifice.  However, given my situation I thought 2 center pawns were adequate booty for a badly placed knight
moves.17... Qh4+ 18. Kd1 Qxh3 19. Nc4: The next few moves I am very proud of because I contemplated them deeply.  It seemed like in every option I was up; however it was a very precarious situation.
moves.19... Qg2 20. Kd2 Bh6+ 21. Kc2 Nf4 22. R: Gaining a knight for free while destroying his structure and setting up possible retaliatory attacks in the center.
moves.24. Rge1 Rad8 25. b4 Bxf3 26. Rhf1: At this point he resigned due to the obvious 26... Bg4 which would have secured me at a 7 piece advantage with a weak, but sufficient, pawn structure and support.  I would like to thank Alin for putting on a great game and having the better of me for most of the game.
